instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PCH_DSWVRMEN:
What is PCH_DSWVRMEN? DSWVRMEN stands for DeepSx Well On-Die Voltage Regulator Enable. This signal enables the internal DSW 1.05 V regulators and must be always pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H 3.3 volts.
If this signal is not being asserted (i.e., not enabled), the on-die voltage regulators responsible for supplying power in deep sleep states may not be active. This could lead to the MacBook failing to exit from a deep sleep state or having issues when trying to enter one, contributing to a scenario where the device does not power on.

If the signal is not present or not at the correct levels, it could indicate a problem with the Platform Controller Hub (PCH) itself..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.PCH_SRTCRST_L: What is PCH_SRTCRST_L? PCH_SRTCRST_L is a reset signal present for the RTC circuit that asserts when it is low in voltage, that is what _L means..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMC’s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air 2017
threads.message:
Hello, it seems like a week of problems with macbook air. Equipment without liquid damage, no history any problems, never repair.

Green led and then orange. With the logic board disassembly, the same but the fan does not move. CPU DEAD?

some voltages:

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 16.5 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4 V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.6 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 0 V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air 2017
threads.message:
When you have missing <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, don't bother searching S4, or S3 voltages.

Post <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL> and the 4 PCH's RTC signals.
Check diode mode to ground on all big coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air 2017
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL> 3,30v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.40v
<SIGNAL>PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL> 0.38v
<SIGNAL>PCH_SRTCRST_L</SIGNAL> 3.40v
<SIGNAL>RTC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.40v
PCH INTRUDER L 3.08V
PCH INTVRMEN  3,30V
<SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL> 3,30V

sorry but I don't understand "check diode mode to ground on all big coils"

Im check diode mode to ground  <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> for short but all right

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air 2017
threads.message:
"I don't understand "check diode mode to ground on all big coils""
Just check diode mode to ground.
You know how to do it on <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, but not on coils?
FlexBV software usually gives some readings; if you don't have good board for comparison.

However, your problem shouldn't be caused by a short there.
Do you get <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air 2017
threads.message:
omg sorry I have only short in L7310/20 but I have my laptop that works perfect and I have the same continuity to ground

im check all Lxxxx

<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> 3,40v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> 3,26v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air 2017
threads.message:
Low value on CPU coils doesn't mean short.

Post <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> voltages; pins 23, 22, 12, 13, 29, 21.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air 2017
threads.message:
Hello, when I have checked the <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> I have been able to observe corrosion on pin 23, I do not understand how it could have formed without liquid damage. I have cleaned it and it works perfect. thanks a million friend

It is the second board with this problem, the previous one was on pin 15 maybe I don't remember

thx
